key_themes: AI sector momentum and mega-cap dominance
Year-end liquidation cycles creating breadth divergence
Regulatory tightening and corporate guidance deterioration
Geopolitical uncertainty (China sanctions, U.S. defense exposure)
Capital spending multiplier effects supporting domestic risk assets
risk_factors: Mid-cap weakness (IWM) persisting while mega-caps rally signals distributionâ€”potential capitulation or acceleration risk into January
Geopolitical escalation (China-U.S. tensions, Taiwan defense developments) unpriced into current technicals
Corporate guidance cuts and earnings disappointment emerging in software/financial sectors; narrative-reality divergence widening
analysis.intraday_levels: SPY: Watch $700 Call Wall (ACTIVE resistance, 146k OI); support at $670 (ACTIVE, 45k OI). QQQ: Resistance at $630 (33k OI ACTIVE) and $625 (29k OI ACTIVE); Max Pain $620 provides support gravity. Expect choppy consolidation with upside lean on light holiday volume; breakout confirmation above $700 (SPY) or $630 (QQQ) required to unlock continuation.
analysis.swing_levels: SPY: Swing target SPX 7000 (per Twitter technical pivot) contingent on holding above $670 support and clearing $700 Call Wall. Put Wall $640 (153k OI) becomes significant support if 5-7% pullback develops. QQQ: $640 resistance (31k OI) and Put Wall $590 (164k OI) define 5-day trading range. Post-holiday volume recovery (early January) will confirm whether current moves represent conviction or exhaustion.
